reviewText:
Great Little Game!
Great Game Play, Nice Soundtrack !

This is a great little retro inspired slasher, with some minor dark souls inspired elements. But dont go expecting a 2D dark souls, this is not that.

Really great to pick up and play for a short time and then come back to it again and again.
Really nice progression system.

There really isn't anything to dislike here. And for 3 bucks. Hell yeah pick this up.

reviewText: Slash or die is an example of a penny plain but addictive indi-game.\nIt really worth playing.

reviewText:
Great little game, two controls LMB to move, RMB to attack. Super Simple.

Dodge the enemies and kill them when you have enough stamina, nice (but small) soundtrack.

Combat can be fun, though has a bug I think if you are to close when you attack at an enemy and you go right through them without dealing damage.

Progression system is nice, collect souls of enemies you slay and spend on upgrades.

Bosses are a definitive plus, and when you kill them you unlock new playable characters.

For $2.99 you should definitly buy and play this.

reviewText: So you slash enemies and they die. If you fail to slash an enemy, and enemy slashes you instead, you die. Slash or Die.\n\nBut seriously, it's a fun casual action-rpg. Check it out.

reviewText:
Slash or Die is a fast paced, action arcade, hack and slash that seems deceptively simple at first but, definitely has a level of skill mastery associated with it.

The game features:
+ Increasingly difficult gameplay
+ Unlockable characters
+ Character progression through upgrades
+ Bosses

Are just some of the key features of this game. Very 'pick up and play' but, also very punishing if you make a mistake. The trance inducing music, clean pixel animations, and the flow of successful combo massacres is satisfying to say the least. I would love to see this come to mobile in the future, but for now I would definitely recommend it if you're looking to kill time.
voteText: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Not bad at all. It's a bit slow in the beginning, and could use some polish (it feels clunkier than it probably should, and sometimes the slash doesn't hit enemies it should), but for this price, it's a very good, very simple little game. The bosses and later enemies add some strategy into the game, and it doesn't feel like a mindless clickfest. No real, major downsides like other people have already said. It succeeds well in what it does.
voteText: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Slash or Die – is a game that gives you action and hardcore. I actually felt adrenaline rush every time successfully dodging attack and making mincemeat of a horde of monsters!!!\nNice graphics and animation, well-made soundtracks, balanced leveling-up system. And also a hardcore that doesn’t make you mad but makes you willing to go on playing and path the way to it’s end. That is what I liked in Slash or Die. Totally recommend!!!
voteText: 5 of 7 people (71%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Easy to pick up and a little masterpiece for simplicity.

Roguelike game with ingame points to spent for upgrades, think about more health, stamina (which is used to attack), speed, damage and certain skills (depending on class).

Left mouse button to move, right mouse button to attack.
Three different classes of which two have to be unlocked, so far I played the warrior and berserker and both feel very different to play, while still being equally balanced.

Good to play for a while and to pick up later on.
Definitely worth the 3 bucks, even more so if it gets on sale.
Oh yeah and it has an awesome oldschool soundtrack which totaly fits the game!

If you wan't to see some gameplay with the first boss check the video below
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MIIuuWBi00M

reviewText: great little game - its a grind but addictive. This game is right up there with Deep DUngeons of Doom and Ubermosh - if you like those you will like this one!

reviewText:
Slash or Die is an arcade style hack-and-slash adventure type game. The gameplay is fast and fun and the game walks the fine line between challenging enough to make you keep trying and being so hard you rage quit very well. This is not an amazing game but it is still pretty good and you would have a hard time finding a better game for $3.

The game does feel a like a bit of a grind at times and I have an issue with some of the mechanics but it was an overall enjoyable experience. The developers are constantly updating the game and actually fixed one of my biggest issues with the game while I was making this review. I expect this game will continue to get better so I suggest you try it out.

If you want a more in depth review, check out my video review: https://youtu.be/OaMDNOTGSnc

reviewText: Solid little game for the price, haven't encountered any problems or bugs.  Will probably get a hour hours of enjoyment out of it.

This game is great im actually suprised its not more! Hopefully new charecters are on the way and maybe even some kind of mode just to play against bosses. But, any way the game is great for the price i cant wait till its complete if it isnt already since its an indie. Does have a few bugs but nothing serious at all. If you like Souls/borne games grab this its really fun to sit back and play as well as keeping you on your toes!
